abstract: Saudi Telecom, the largest phone company in Saudi Arabia, bought a 25 percent stake in Maxis Communications of Malaysia for 11.4 billion riyals ($3 billion) to tap growth in developing markets like India. Saudi Telecom bought the shares from a Malaysian billionaire, T. Ananda Krishnan, who last month offered to buy the 40 percent that he did not already control in Maxis, which is based in Kuala Lumpur and is the country’s largest mobile phone operator.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Telecom, the largest phone company in Saudi Arabia, bought a 25 percent stake in Maxis Communications of Malaysia for 11.4 billion riyals ($3 billion) to tap growth in developing markets like India. Saudi Telecom bought the shares from a Malaysian billionaire, T. Ananda Krishnan, who last month offered to buy the 40 percent that he did not already control in Maxis, which is based in Kuala Lumpur and is the country’s largest mobile phone operator.

headline.main: Saudi Telecom Phones In Malaysia Deal
